snippet: After Hurricane Sandy’s watery wrath remade parts of New York City’s coastline, could a long lost ship have finally been found off the South Bronx?
abstract: Steven Smith's hopes of finding remains of British frigate HMS Hussar, British frigate that sank in the East River in 1780, in South Bronx are renewed after Hurricane Sandy remade parts of New York City’s coastline; he discovered curved wooden joints on shores of the South Bronx that might have formed the side of ship and has contacted experts to identify wooden remains.
lead_paragraph: After Hurricane Sandy’s watery wrath remade parts of New York City’s coastline, could a long lost ship have finally been found off the South Bronx?

headline.main: Finding Trash and Worse, but So Far, No Ship With Treasure
headline.print_headline: Finding Trash and Worse, but So Far, No Ship Filled With Treasure
